Framework
Class CoreMgr

java.lang.Object
  Framework.CoreMgr
All Implemented Interfaces:
ICoreMgr
public class CoreMgr
extends java.lang.Object
implements ICoreMgr

Core is intended to provide the core functionality for the top-level aquarium simulation class. Note that the top-level simulation class must implement the simulation loop.

Version:
0.4
Author:
Marc Price

Method Detail

addRenderable

public void addRenderable(Renderable token)
Add a renderable object to the world.

Specified by:
addRenderable in interface ICoreMgr
Parameters:
token - an object of type Renderable that is to be displayed in the virtual world.

createWorld

public void createWorld()
METHOD: create and initialise the environment (aka 'world')

Specified by:
createWorld in interface ICoreMgr

destroyWorld

public void destroyWorld()
METHOD: destroy the 3D world. Although there is a garbage-collector in Java, the world has to be destroyed with 'destroyWorld' in order to close-down your simulation-loop cleanly.

Specified by:
destroyWorld in interface ICoreMgr

removeRenderable

public void removeRenderable(Renderable token)
Remove a renderable object from the world.

Specified by:
removeRenderable in interface ICoreMgr
Parameters:
token - an object of type Renderable that is to be removed from the virtual world.

updateWorld

public void updateWorld()
Apply all updates to the environment. This must be called at the end of each pass through the simulation loop.

Specified by:
updateWorld in interface ICoreMgr

Accessor for the Env3D world object

Specified by:

the Env3D world object
